LocaleUtils

LocaleUtils is a set of functions used to localize the component (see: Advanced localization). You may want to implement your own LocaleUtils, or override some of its functions.

Usually you won‚Äôt need to use these functions. The component can be localized using months, weekdaysLong, weekdaysShort and firstDayOfWeek props.

For example, this code renders the month‚Äôs title as M/YYYY instead of the default:

import DayPicker, { LocaleUtils } from "react-day-picker";

function formatMonthTitle(d, locale) {
 return `${d.getMonth() + 1}/${d.getFullYear()}`
}

<DayPicker localeUtils={ { ...LocaleUtils, formatMonthTitle } } />

Functions

formatDay (d: date, locale: String) ‚áí String

Format the string used as aria-label for the given day.

formatMonthTitle (d: date, locale: String) ‚áí String

Return the string used to format the month‚Äôs title in react-day-picker for the given date d.

formatWeekdayShort (i: number, locale: String) ‚áí String

Return the string used to render the weekday‚Äôs short name, e.g. Mo for Monday.

formatWeekdayLong (i: number, locale: String) ‚áí String

Return the string used to render the weekday‚Äôs long name (starting from 0 as Sunday).

getFirstDayOfWeek (locale: String) ‚áí number

Return the first day of the week for the given locale (starting from 0 as Sunday).

getMonths (locale: String) ‚áí Array

Return the twelve months for the given locale (full name, e.g. January).
